remarks: A ring homomorphism preserves ` 0 ` .  (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 2-Jan-2011.)
statement:
rnghom0.1 $e |- G = ( 1st ` R ) $.
rnghom0.2 $e |- Z = ( GId ` G ) $.
rnghom0.3 $e |- J = ( 1st ` S ) $.
rnghom0.4 $e |- W = ( GId ` J ) $.
rngohom0 $p |- ( ( R e. RingOps /\ S e. RingOps /\ F e. ( R RngHom S ) ) -> ( F ` Z ) = W ) $.
